physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient presented with severe thrombocytopenia during pregnancy, with a historical platelet count of 20,000 giga/l at the time of previous delivery.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial platelet count at consultation was 46,000 giga/l; fell to 36,000 giga/l on the day of delivery, and subsequently decreased to 30,000 giga/l before a planned spinal anesthetic was changed to a general anesthetic. After transfusion and treatment, platelet counts progressively increased to 53,000 giga/l at discharge.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: No postpartum hemorrhagic complications occurred and no additional thrombogenic products were needed.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Serial platelet counts increased from 20,000 giga/l at 6 hours post-delivery to 53,000 giga/l at discharge on postoperative day four.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Initial presentation with a history of clopidogrel use, with platelet count on the second postoperative day at 161 /H1100310^9/l.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The platelet count was at the lower limit of the normal range before the surgery at 161 /H1100310^9/l.
